did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen Annual Report of the Legislative Board
did.abstract: Annual report of the Legislative Board of the Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the Annual Report of the Legislative Board of the Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen in the State of New York, for the year 1961.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen Annual Report of the Legislative Board #6312m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen (BRT) was a labor organization for railroad employees founded in 1883. Originally called the Brotherhood of Railroad Brakemen, its purpose was to negotiate contracts with railroad management and to provide insurance for members. The BRT grew to become the largest brotherhood of operating railroad employees. In 1969, it merged with three other unions to form the United Transportation Union.
